intro: Nellica maderaspatana, commonly known as the Indian nettle or *Urena lobata*, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm. The plant features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy surface and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pink. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Nellica maderaspatana is often found in disturbed soils and is used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
